member.name: T:TXTextControl.ApplicationField
member.summary: The ApplicationField object supports text field formats of applications such as Microsoft Word.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationField.getFormat
member.summary: Gets the field's format.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationField.getParameters
member.summary: Gets the field' parameters. The order and format of the strings depend on the field's format. For example a Microsoft Word MergeField has the following format: MERGEFIELD FieldName [switches]. In this case the first string of the array is the FieldName and the following strings are possible switches. The string MERGEFIELD is the type name of the field and can be obtained through getTypeName. If a field has no parameters, this array is null.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationField.getTypeName
member.summary: Gets the field's type name. The type name of a Microsoft Word MergeField is MERGEFIELD, for example. If the type name of the field is changed, its parameters must also be changed.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationField.setFormat
member.summary: Sets the field's format.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationField.setParameters
member.summary: Sets the field's parameters.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationField.setTypeName
member.summary: Sets the field's type name. The type name of a Microsoft Word MergeField is MERGEFIELD, for example. If the type name of the field is changed, its parameters must also be changed.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection
member.summary: Contains all created or imported Microsoft Word fields represented through objects of the type ApplicationField.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection.add
member.summary: Inserts a new application field at the current input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection.getItem
member.summary: Gets the field at the current input position or null, if there is no such field at the current input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection.remove
member.summary: Removes a field of the type ApplicationField from a TX Text Control document. The visible text is deleted depending on the keepText parameter.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.BarcodeCallback
member.summary: Callback function for a barcode related event.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection
member.summary: Contains all barcodes in a document represented through objects of the type BarcodeFrame.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.addAnchored
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new barcode which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified horizontal alignment and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored barcodes are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.addAnchoredAtLocation
member.summary: Inserts a new barcode which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified location relative to the paragraph it is anchored to and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored barcode are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.addAtFixedPositionInDocument
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new barcode which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a location relative to the top left corner of the complete document. All gaps between the pages must be included.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.addAtFixedPositionOnPage
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.addInline
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new barcode inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The barcode is inserted at the specified text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.addWithMouse
member.summary: Inserts a barcode with the built-in mouse interface. The barcode's size is determined through the end-user. A cross cursor indicates where the barcode can be inserted. Changing the document aborts the insertion process.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.getItem
member.summary: Gets the barcode selected by the user or the barcode with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.getItemByName
member.summary: Gets the barcode with the specified name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.BarcodeCollection.remove
member.summary: Removes a barcode.

member.summary: Gets the comment's number. The first comment in the document has the number 1. The number is defined through the textflow. Commented text with a smaller start position has a smaller comment number.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DateFormField
member.summary: A DateFormField object represents a date field on a form.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DateFormField.getDate
member.summary: Gets the DateFormField's date.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DateFormField.getDateFormat
member.summary: Gets the date's format. For a certain DateFormField the format string should be one of the strings returned through the getSupportedDateFormats function. A TextControl uses Day, Month, Year, and Era Format Picture strings to format a date. When this date's format is an empty string, which is the default value, a default format is used depending on the culture set for the date field's text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DateFormField.getEmptyWidth
member.summary: Gets the horizontal extension, in twips, of the date formfield, when it is empty.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DateFormField.getSupportedDateFormats
member.summary: Gets an array of format picture strings which can be used to format the date. The returned format strings depend on the culture set for the date field's text. A TextControl uses Day, Month, Year, and Era Format Picture strings to format a date.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DateFormField.setDate
member.summary: Sets the DateFormField's date.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DateFormField.setDateFormat
member.summary: Sets the date's format. For a certain DateFormField the format string should be one of the strings returned through the getSupportedDateFormats function. A TextControl uses Day, Month, Year, and Era Format Picture strings to format a date. When this date's format is an empty string, which is the default value, a default format is used depending on the culture set for the date field's text.

member.summary: Gets the file's data as a base64 string.

member.summary: Gets the date the file was last modified as a unix timestamp.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.EmbeddedFile.getMIMEType
member.summary: Gets an optional string specifying the file's type using types specified through the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) specification. When a file is embedded and a type is not specified the default type application/octet-stream is used.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.EmbeddedFile.getRelationship
member.summary: PDF/A only. Gets an optional string describing the relationship of the embedded file and the containing document. This string can be a predefined value or should follow the rules for second-class names (ISO 32000-1, Annex E). Predefined values are "Source", "Data", "Alternative", "Supplement" or "Unspecified".

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Footnote
member.summary: A Footnote object represents a footnote in a TextControl document.

member.summary: Sets the current text input position in the footnote section at the end of the current footnote text, so that the text can be edited or formatted.

member.summary: Gets the highlight color for the reference mark and the footnote mark.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the reference mark and the footnote mark is highlighted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Footnote.getID
member.summary: Gets a user-defined identifier. It must be a one-based value. A value of zero indicates that the footnote has no identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Footnote.getName
member.summary: Gets the footnote's name. An empty string indicates that the footnote has no name.

member.summary: Gets the footnote's number in the text. The first footnote in the document has the number 1. The number is defined through the textflow.

member.summary: Gets the number of characters the reference mark consists of.

member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the reference mark and the footnote mark is highlighted.

member.summary: Represents a form field.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the form field is enabled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormField.setEnabled
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the form field is enabled. This property has only an effect, when the when the edit mode is set to TXTextControl.EditMode.ReadAndSelect and the allowEditingFormFields property of the document permissions has been set to true. In this case a Formfield can only be edited, when its Enabled property is true. When a FormField is disabled, the TextFieldClicked and TextFieldDoubleClicked of the Formfield are suppressed. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle
member.summary: The FormattingStyle object represents a styling for a text range.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.apply
member.summary: Applies all set attributes of the style to the current document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getAutoBaseline
member.summary: Gets values specifying automatic sub- or superscripted text. When using automatic sub- and superscript the font is scaled and moved above or below the baseline with values defined through the font itself. Automatic sub- and superscript can be combined with a user-defined baseline which can be set with the Baseline property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getBaseline
member.summary: Gets the baseline alignment, in twips, of the style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getBaseStyle
member.summary: Gets the FormattingStyle which is the base style of this style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getBold
member.summary: Gets the bold attribute of the style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getCapitals
member.summary: Gets values specifying wheather lowercase letters are displayed with capital letters. Lowercase letters are displayed either with capital letters of the same size or with capital letters which have a smaller size. The smaller size is either the size of the lowercase 'x' (petite caps) or the size of the lowercase 'x' + 10% (small caps).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getCharacterScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the style's character scaling, in percent of the average character width.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getCharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets the style's character spacing value, in twips. This value is added to each character. When it is negative, character spacing is reduced, otherwise it is extended.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getCulture
member.summary: Gets the culture as a languagecode2-country / regioncode2 string value. Takes a callback function as a parameter which is called with a languagecode2-country / regioncode2 string ("de-DE", "en-US" or "en", for example) as a parameter upon receiving the culture value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getFontName
member.summary: Gets the font of the style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getFontSize
member.summary: Gets the font's size of the style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getForeColor
member.summary: Gets the style's color used to display the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getItalic
member.summary: Gets the italic attribute of the style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getName
member.summary: Gets the name of the style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FormattingStyle.getStrikeout
member.summary: Gets the strikeout attribute of the style.

member.summary: Gets the style's text background color.

member.summary: Gets the underlining styles for the style.

member.summary: The FrameBase object is the base of the Image, TextFrame and BarcodeFrame object.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.changeZOrder
member.summary: Changes the frame's z-order.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getAlignment
member.summary: Gets the frame's horizontal alignment when it is anchored to a paragraph.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getBounds
member.summary: Gets the frame's bounding rectangle relative to the upper left corner of the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getID
member.summary: Gets an identifier for the frame. A value of zero indicates that the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing has no identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getInsertionMode
member.summary: Gets a value determining whether the frame is treated as a single character or the document's text either flows around or overwrites the frame. If the document's text flows around or overwrites the frame, this property also determines whether the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is moved with the text or fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getLocation
member.summary: Gets, in twips, the frame's current location. If the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is anchored to a paragraph, the location is relative to the paragraph. Otherwise, it is relative to the document. If the frame has a horizontal alignment or if it is inserted inline, this property returns zero. This property cannot be set for images, text frames, charts, barcodes or drawings which are inserted inline.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getMoveable
member.summary: Gets whether a frame can be moved in the document at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getName
member.summary: Gets the name for the frame. An empty string indicates that the frame has no name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getSize
member.summary: Gets the frame's size in twips.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getSizeable
member.summary: Gets whether the frame can be resized at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getTextDistances
member.summary: Gets the distances, in twips, between the frame and the document's text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.getTextPosition
member.summary: Gets the frame's character position in the document's text (one-based).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setAlignment
member.summary: Sets the frame's horizontal alignment when it is anchored to a paragraph.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setID
member.summary: Sets an identifier for the frame. It must be a one-based value. A value of zero indicates that the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing has no identifier. Zero can also be used to delete a previously set identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setInsertionMode
member.summary: Sets a value determining whether the frame is treated as a single character or the document's text either flows around or overwrites the frame. If the document's text flows around or overwrites the frame, this property also determines whether the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is moved with the text or fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setLocation
member.summary: Sets, in twips, the frame's current location. If the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is anchored to a paragraph, the location is relative to the paragraph. Otherwise, it is relative to the document. If the frame has a horizontal alignment or if it is inserted inline, this property returns zero. This property cannot be set for images, text frames, charts, barcodes or drawings which are inserted inline.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setMoveable
member.summary: Sets whether a frame can be moved in the document at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setName
member.summary: Sets a name for the frame. An empty string indicates that the frame has no name. An empty string can also be used to delete a previously set name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setSize
member.summary: Sets the frame's size in twips. For images this property is read only. To change the size of an image in a document, use the setHorizontalScaling and setVerticalScaling methods.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setSizeable
member.summary: Sets whether the frame can be resized at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.FrameBase.setTextDistances
member.summary: Sets the distances, in twips, between the frame and the document's text. If a value is set to -1, it is not changed.

member.summary: Base of all collections containing frame objects.

member.summary: Removes all objects from the collection and from the document.

member.summary: Contains all headers and footers in a document or part of the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterCollection.add
member.summary: Adds a new header or footer to a document or to a certain section of the document. If a header or footer is added to the complete document the first section receives the header or footer and all other sections receive headers or footers which are connected to their previous section. To add more than one header or footer a combination of the HeaderFooterType enumeration values can be used.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.addAnchored
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new image which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified horizontal alignment and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored image are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.addAnchoredAtLocation
member.summary: Inserts a new image which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified location relative to the paragraph it is anchored to and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored images are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.addAtFixedPosition
member.summary: Obsolete. This method will be removed in one of the next versions. Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.addAtFixedPositionInDocument
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a location relative to the top left corner of the complete document. All gaps between the pages must be included.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.addAtFixedPositionOnPage
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.addInline
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new image inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The image is inserted at the specified text input position.

member.summary: Gets the image selected by the user or the image with the specified identifier.

member.summary: Sets the structure level of all selected paragraphs. The level can be between 0 and 10. A level of 0 indicates that the paragraph belongs to the body of the document.

member.summary: Sets the formatting style name at the current input position.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord
member.summary: The MisspelledWord object represents a misspelled word in a document's text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.getIsDuplicate
member.summary: Gets a value which marks the misspelled word as duplicate.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.getIsIgnored
member.summary: Gets a value which marks the misspelled word as ignored. An ignored misspelled word remains in the collection of misspelled words, but it is not underlined in the text with a red zigzag line

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.getLength
member.summary: Gets the length of a misspelled word.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.getNumber
member.summary: Gets the number of this misspelled word. All misspelled words are counted from the beginning to the end of a document. The first word has the number 1.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.getStart
member.summary: Gets the starting position of a misspelled word. It is a one-based index of the word's first character.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.getText
member.summary: Gets the text of the misspelled word.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.select
member.summary: Selects the misspelled word in the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.setIsDuplicate
member.summary: Sets a value which marks the misspelled word as duplicate. A duplicate word is not misspelled, but it has the same text as the word in front of it.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.setIsIgnored
member.summary: Sets a value which marks the misspelled word as ignored. An ignored misspelled word remains in the collection of misspelled words, but it is not underlined in the text with a red zigzag line.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection
member.summary: The MisspelledWordCollection contains all misspelled words in the main part of a Text Control document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.getCountOf
member.summary: Gets the number of misspelled words with a special meaning from the collection.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.getItemAtInputPosition
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word of the specified kind at the current text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word of is returned. If there is no misspelled word of the specified kind between the current input position and the end of the text, the first word of the specified kind is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.getItemAtLocation
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at a certain geometrical location. If there is no misspelled word, null is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.getItemAtTextPosition
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word of the specified kind at the specified text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word of the specified kind between the specified input position and the end of the text, the first word of the specified kind is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.ignore
member.summary: Changes the text of the specified misspelled word and marks it as ignored. Ignored misspelled words are not underlined with a red zigzag line.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.remove
member.summary: Removes the specified misspelled word from a Text Control document. The method removes the word's reference in the list of misspelled words and replaces the word's text with the specified text.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo
member.summary: Information about a misspelled word.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo.isDuplicate
member.summary: A value which marks the misspelled word as duplicate.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo.isIgnored
member.summary: A value which marks the misspelled word as ignored.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo.length
member.summary: The length of the misspelled word.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo.number
member.summary: The number of the misspelled word.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo.start
member.summary: The starting position of the misspelled word.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordInfo.text
member.summary: The text of the misspelled word.

member.summary: Adds a new section at the specified text input position. The new section ends at the end position of the section containing the input position. If a new section is inserted in a paragraph or table, the paragraph or table is split into two paragraphs or tables.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.changeCapitalization
member.summary: Changes the capitalization of all selected characters depending on the 'capitalizationParameter' parameter.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.changeDirection
member.summary: Changes the writing direction of all selected paragraphs. When the direction of a paragraph is changed, this paragraph's alignment is toggled from left to right or from right to left. The alignment of centered and justified paragraphs is not changed. Left and right tabulators are also toggled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.decreaseIndent
member.summary: Decreases the left indent of all paragraphs contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method decreases the left indent at the text input position. Left indent positions are defined through the paragraphs' tab positions and the indents of the paragraphs in front and behind the paragraph with the text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getAutoBaseline
member.summary: Gets values specifying automatic sub- or superscripted text. When using automatic sub- and superscript the font is scaled and moved above or below the baseline with values defined through the font itself. Automatic sub- and superscript can be combined with a user-defined baseline which can be set with the Baseline property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getBaseline
member.summary: Gets the baseline alignment, in twips, of the selected text. Takes a callback function as a parameter which is called with the baseline alignment, in twips, of the selected text. Positive values moves the baseline to superscript, negative values move the baseline to subscript.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getBold
member.summary: Gets the bold attribute of the selected text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getCapitals
member.summary: Gets values specifying wheather lowercase letters are displayed with capital letters. Lowercase letters are displayed either with capital letters of the same size or with capital letters which have a smaller size. The smaller size is either the size of the lowercase 'x' (petite caps) or the size of the lowercase 'x' + 10% (small caps).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getCharacterScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the style's character scaling, in percent of the average character width.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getCharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets the style's character spacing value, in twips. This value is added to each character. When it is negative, character spacing is reduced, otherwise it is extended.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getCulture
member.summary: Gets the culture as a languagecode2-country / regioncode2 string value. Takes a callback function as a parameter which is called with a languagecode2-country / regioncode2 string ("de-DE", "en-US" or "en", for example) as a parameter upon receiving the selection information from the server.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getFontName
member.summary: Gets the font name of the selected text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getFontSize
member.summary: Gets the font's size, in points, of the selected text.

member.summary: Gets the color used to display the selected text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.getFormattingStyle
member.summary: Gets the formatting style of the selected text.

member.summary: Gets the italic attribute of the selected text.

member.summary: Gets the number of selected characters.

member.summary: Gets the starting point of selected text.

member.summary: Gets the strikeout attribute of the selected text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.growFont
member.summary: Increases the font size of each font contained in the current text selection.If no text is selected, this method increases the font size at the text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.increaseIndent
member.summary: Increases the left indent of all paragraphs contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method increases the left indent at the text input position. Left indent positions are defined through the paragraphs' tab positions and the indents of the paragraphs in front and behind the paragraph with the text input position.

member.summary: Callback function for an event related to a signature field.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection
member.summary: Contains all signature fields of a Text Control document or part of the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.addAnchored
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new signature field which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified horizontal alignment and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored text frames are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.addAnchoredAtLocation
member.summary: Inserts a new signature field which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified location relative to the paragraph it is anchored to and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored signature fields are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.addAtFixedPositionInDocument
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new signature field which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a location relative to the top left corner of the complete document. All gaps between the pages must be included.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.addAtFixedPositionOnPage
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.addInline
member.summary: Inserts a signature field inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The signature field is inserted at the specified text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.addWithMouse
member.summary: Inserts a signature field with the built-in mouse interface. The signature field's size is determined through the end-user. A cross cursor indicates where the signature field can be inserted. Changing the document aborts the insertion process.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.getItem
member.summary: Gets the signature field selected by the user or the signature field with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.getItemByName
member.summary: Gets the signature field with the specified name.

member.summary: Removes a signature field from a Text Control document.

member.summary: Gets the subtextpart's number. The first subtextpart has the number 1. The number is defined through the textflow. A textpart with a smaller start position has a smaller number. When an outer subtextpart has the same start position than one of its nested textparts the outer textpart has a smaller number.

member.summary: Specifies the result when a subtextpart has been added to the document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Error
member.summary: An unexpected error has occurred.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Successful
member.summary: The subtextpart has successfully been inserted.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.NoSelection
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because there is no selection.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.SelectionTooComplex
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because the selection is too complex. It is not a continuous sequence of characters.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.PositionInvalid
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because the specified position values are invalid. Invalid start and/or length values have been specified.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.AlreadyExists
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because it already exists.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Overlapping
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because it overlaps with an existing textpart.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Combined
member.summary: The subtextpart was inserted and combined with an existing one. A subtextpart is combined with an existing one, when it immediately follows it and has the same name and id.

member.summary: Determines how text is appended to the document.

member.summary: The loaded text is inserted at the end of the last paragraph of the existing document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AppendSettings.StartWithNewParagraph
member.summary: A new paragraph is created at the end of the document and the text is inserted in this paragraph.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AppendSettings.StartWithNewSection
member.summary: A new section is created at the end of the document and the text is inserted in this section.

member.summary: The possible application field formats.

member.summary: Unspecified field format.

member.summary: The field is supported and defined through Microsoft Word.

member.summary: The field is supported and defined through the Heiler HighEdit component.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldFormat.MSWordTXFormFields
member.summary: This value can only be used with the LoadSettings.ApplicationFieldFormat property.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoBaseline
member.summary: Specifies how text is automatically sub- or superscripted.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoBaseline.Superscript
member.summary: Text is moved above the baseline.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoBaseline.Subscript
member.summary: Text is moved below the baseline.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoBaseline.SuperscriptUpperEdge
member.summary: Text is scaled und moved above the baseline. The moved text does not extend above the upper edge of capital letters. This can be used for nominators of diagonal fractions.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoBaseline.SubscriptBaseline
member.summary: Text is scaled, but is not moved below the baseline. This can be used for denominators of diagonal fractions.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoBaseline.None
member.summary: Text is scaled, but is not moved below the baseline. This can be used for denominators of diagonal fractions.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.AutoGenerationType
member.summary: Defines the type of document link auto-generation.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ViewMode.PageView
member.summary: Text is formatted like in Normal view mode, and additionally the Text Control displays the pages in 3D view with gaps and a desktop background. Headers and footers are displayed in WYSIWYG mode.

member.summary: Text is formatted according to the settings of the PageSize and the PageMargins properties. Headers and footers can be inserted but they are not displayed.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder
member.summary: Specifies how the z-order of a frame (image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing) can be changed.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder.Bottom
member.summary: If the frame is in front of the text, it becomes the bottommost of all objects in front of the text. If it is behind the text, it is becomes the bottommost of all objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder.BottomMost
member.summary: The frame is moved behind the text below all other objects. This member is only possible, if the insertion mode is BehindTheText.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder.Down
member.summary: The frame is moved down one plane. If it is the bottommost object in front of the text, it is not moved behind the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder.TopMost
member.summary: The frame is moved in front of the text at the top of all other objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder.Top
member.summary: If the frame is behind the text, it becomes the topmost of all objects behind the text. If it is in front of the text, it becomes the topmost of all objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.ZOrder.Up
member.summary: The frame is moved up one plane. If it is the topmost object behind the text, it is not moved in front of the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.beginUndoAction
member.summary: Begins a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between beginUndoAction and endUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step. The specified user-defined name is available via getUndoActionName.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.btoaUTF8
member.summary: Creates a base-64 encoded ASCII string from a unicode string. In contrast to the browser provided method btoa() this method handles all unicode characters and not only characters in the Latin1 range.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.endUndoAction
member.summary: Ends a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between beginUndoAction and endUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getCanStyleFormat

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getForeColor

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getFormattingPrinter
member.summary: Returns the name of the currently selected formatting printer by calling a provided callback function. For more information on the formatting printer see function setFormattingPrinter.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getFormulaReferenceStyle
member.summary: Gets a value determining how references to table cells in formulas are specified. Supported are the A1 and the R1C1 notation. The A1 notation specifies a table cell with a column letter and a row number, for example B3 refers to the table cell in the third row and the second column. The R1C1 notation addresses a table cell with a row number and a column number, for example R3C2 refers to the table cell in the third row and the second column. Relative addresses can be expressed with square brackets. R[-3]C[-2]. The numbers inside the square brackets show how many rows or columns the cell is relative to itself. Negative row numbers mean that the referenced cell is above the cell containing the formula. Negative column numbers mean that the referenced cell is to the left of the cell containing the formula.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getInstalledPrinters
member.summary: Gets the names of the printers installed on the server which are usable by Text Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getIsFormFieldValidationEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether form field validation is active or not.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getIsFormulaCalculationEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether formulas in tables are automatically calculated when the text of an input cell is changed.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.setFormattingPrinter
member.summary: Sets the name of a printer the text dimensions and capabilities of which are used to format the document. If the document is printed with this printer the displayed and the printed document have the same dimensions. If the property is set to "Standard", the system installed standard printer is used to format the document. If the property is set to "Display", the font dimensions of the display device are used to format the document. If the specified printer is not installed, the standard printer is used.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.setFormulaReferenceStyle
member.summary: Sets a value determining how references to table cells in formulas are specified. Supported are the A1 and the R1C1 notation. The A1 notation specifies a table cell with a column letter and a row number, for example B3 refers to the table cell in the third row and the second column. The R1C1 notation addresses a table cell with a row number and a column number, for example R3C2 refers to the table cell in the third row and the second column. Relative addresses can be expressed with square brackets. R[-3]C[-2]. The numbers inside the square brackets show how many rows or columns the cell is relative to itself. Negative row numbers mean that the referenced cell is above the cell containing the formula. Negative column numbers mean that the referenced cell is to the left of the cell containing the formula.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings
member.summary: The SaveSettings class provides properties for advanced settings and information during save operations.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssSaveMode
member.summary: HTML only. Specifies how to save stylesheet data with an HTML document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssSaveMode.None
member.summary: All format information is saved in the body of the HTML document through HTML tags.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssSaveMode.CreateFile
member.summary: Stylesheets are saved in a newly created CSS file. This file has the same name and location as the corresponding HTML file or is specified through the SaveSettings.CssFileName property. The file is only created if it does not exist. If the HTML document is saved in a memory buffer, this setting cannot be used.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssSaveMode.OverwriteFile
member.summary: Stylesheets are saved in a newly created CSS file. This file has the same name and location as the corresponding HTML file or is specified through the SaveSettings.CssFileName property. If the file already exists, it is overridden. If the HTML document is saved in a memory buffer, this setting cannot be used.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssSaveMode.Inline
member.summary: Stylesheets are saved in the head of the HTML document.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent
member.summary: Specifies data to be omitted when the document is saved.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent.None
member.summary: Nothing is omitted.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent.SubTextParts
member.summary: Subtextparts are omitted. Only the subtextpart is omitted, the text and formatting attributes belonging to the subtextpart are saved.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent.TrackedChanges
member.summary: Tracked changes are omitted. Only the markup is omitted, the text and formatting attributes belonging to the tracked change are saved.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent.EditableRegions
member.summary: Editable regions are omitted. Only the region marker are omitted, the text and formatting attributes belonging to the editable region are saved.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent.Sections
member.summary: Sections are omitted.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent.TextFields
member.summary: Text fields are omitted.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ReportingMergeBlockFormat
member.summary: Specifies how reporting merge blocks are handled when a document is saved.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ReportingMergeBlockFormat.Default
member.summary: The document is saved as it is. Reporting merge blocks are not converted.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ReportingMergeBlockFormat.DocumentTargets
member.summary: If the document contains reporting merge blocks marked with subtextparts, these subtextparts are converted to document targets.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ReportingMergeBlockFormat.SubTextParts
member.summary: This member is not used, when a document is saved.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Table
member.summary: The Table object represents a table in a document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getCanMergeCells
member.summary: Checks whether table cells can be merged. Table cells can only be merged, if more than one cell in this table is selected.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getCanSplit
member.summary: Checks whether this table can be split. A table can only be split if it contains the current input position and no further text is selected.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getCanSplitCells
member.summary: Checks whether previously merged table cells in this table can be split. Only selected table cells can be split.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getID
member.summary: Gets the table's identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getNestedLevel
member.summary: Gets the nested level for the specified table. Top level tables have a level of 1.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getOuterMostTable
member.summary: Gets a table's outermost table. This is a top-level table with a nested level of 1. The property's value is an object of the prototype Table or null if this table is already a top-level table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.getOuterTable
member.summary: Gets table's outer table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.mergeCells
member.summary: Merges all selected table cells in this table. {@link Table#getCanMergeCells} can be used to determine, if table cells can be merged or not.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.select
member.summary: Selects the complete table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.selectCells
member.summary: Selects the part of the table defined through two table cells.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.setID
member.summary: Sets the table's id.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.split
member.summary: Splits a table below or above the current input position. If the table does not contain the current input position it cannot be split. The getCanSplit method can be used to determine if a table can be split or not. If a table is split above the first row a new line is inserted above the table and if a table is split below the last row a new line is inserted below the table. This is useful to insert text above or below a nested table that immediately starts and/or ends at the beginning or the end of the cell in which it is nested.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.splitCells
member.summary: Splits all selected table cells in this table. Only previously merged cells can be split. The getCanSplitCells method can be used to determine, if table cells can be split or not.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.cells
member.summary: The collection of all table cells the table consists of.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.columns
member.summary: Gets a collection of all columns the table consists of.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.nestedTables
member.summary: Gets a collection of all tables nested in this table.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.rows
member.summary: Gets a collection of all rows the table consists of.

member.summary: Gets the table cell's formula. For each table cell a formula can be defined which is used to calculate the cell's text. The formula can contain references to other table cells in the same table. When the text of a referenced cell changes, the cell which references it is automatically updated.

member.summary: Gets the number of characters in the table cell. If the table cell is merged, the property returns -1.

member.summary: Gets the cell's text.

member.summary: Gets, in twips, the width of the cell.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TableCellFormat
member.summary: The TableCellFormat object represents the formatting attributes of a table cell.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TableCellFormat.getBackColor
member.summary: Gets the table cell's background color.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TableCellFormat.getNumberFormat
member.summary: Gets a number format for the table cell. The number format is used, when a formula is defined and the table cell's text is automatically calculated. When a number format is not defined, the property's value is an empty string. The number format string has a format as described in Office Open XML File Formats - ISO/IEC 29500 - 1, Chapter: 18.8.31 Number Formats.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TableCellFormat.getTextType
member.summary: Gets the text type of the table cell which determines whether the cell's text is interpreted as a number or as text When the type is Text, the cell's text is interpreted as text and it is displayed as it is. When the type is Number, the cell's text is interpreted as a number. The period character (.) is defined as decimal separator, the comma character (,) is defined as thousands separator.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TableCellFormat.getVerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets the vertical alignment of the text in the table cell.

member.summary: Sets the table cell's background color.

member.summary: Sets the table cell's number format.

member.summary: Activates the text frame. The text frame receives the input focus. A text frame can only be activated, if the text part that contains the text frame has the input focus.

member.summary: Changes the frame's z-order.

member.summary: Gets the frame's horizontal alignment when it is anchored to a paragraph.

member.summary: Gets the frame's bounding rectangle relative to the upper left corner of the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getID
member.summary: Gets an identifier for the frame. A value of zero indicates that the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing has no identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getInsertionMode
member.summary: Gets a value determining whether the frame is treated as a single character or the document's text either flows around or overwrites the frame. If the document's text flows around or overwrites the frame, this property also determines whether the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is moved with the text or fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getInternalMargins
member.summary: Sets the distances, in twips, between the text frame's border line and the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getLocation
member.summary: Gets, in twips, the frame's current location. If the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is anchored to a paragraph, the location is relative to the paragraph. Otherwise, it is relative to the document. If the frame has a horizontal alignment or if it is inserted inline, this property returns zero. This property cannot be set for images, text frames, charts, barcodes or drawings which are inserted inline.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getMoveable
member.summary: Gets whether a frame can be moved in the document at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getName
member.summary: Gets the name for the frame. An empty string indicates that the frame has no name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getSize
member.summary: Gets the frame's size in twips.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getSizeable
member.summary: Gets whether the frame can be resized at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.summary: Gets the distances, in twips, between the frame and the document's text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getTextPosition
member.summary: Gets the frame's character position in the document's text (one-based).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.getTransparency
member.summary: Gets the text frame's transparency. Zero means opaque and 1.0 means completely transparent.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setAlignment
member.summary: Sets the frame's horizontal alignment when it is anchored to a paragraph.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setBackColor
member.summary: Sets the background color for the text frame.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setBorderColor
member.summary: Sets the border color for the text frame.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setBorderStyle
member.summary: Sets the style of a text frame's border line.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setBorderWidth
member.summary: Sets the width, in twips, of a text frame's border line. To alter the distance between the border line and the text, use the InternalMargins property. If this property is set to zero, the text frame has no border line.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setID
member.summary: Sets an identifier for the frame. It must be a one-based value. A value of zero indicates that the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing has no identifier. Zero can also be used to delete a previously set identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setInsertionMode
member.summary: Sets a value determining whether the frame is treated as a single character or the document's text either flows around or overwrites the frame. If the document's text flows around or overwrites the frame, this property also determines whether the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is moved with the text or fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setInternalMargins
member.summary: Sets the distances, in twips, between the text frame's border line and the text. If a value is set to -1, it is not changed.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setLocation
member.summary: Sets, in twips, the frame's current location. If the image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing is anchored to a paragraph, the location is relative to the paragraph. Otherwise, it is relative to the document. If the frame has a horizontal alignment or if it is inserted inline, this property returns zero. This property cannot be set for images, text frames, charts, barcodes or drawings which are inserted inline.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setMoveable
member.summary: Sets whether a frame can be moved in the document at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setName
member.summary: Sets a name for the frame. An empty string indicates that the frame has no name. An empty string can also be used to delete a previously set name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setSize
member.summary: Sets the frame's size in twips. For images this property is read only.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setSizeable
member.summary: Sets whether the frame can be resized at run time with the built-in mouse interface.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setTextDistances
member.summary: Sets the distances, in twips, between the frame and the document's text. If a value is set to -1, it is not changed.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrame.setTransparency
member.summary: Sets the text frame's transparency. It must be a value between 0.0 and 1.0. Zero means opaque and 1.0 means completely transparent.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFrameCallback
member.summary: Callback function for a text frame related event.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection
member.summary: Contains all text frames of a Text Control document or part of the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.addAnchored
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new text frame which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified horizontal alignment and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored text frames are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.addAnchoredAtLocation
member.summary: Inserts a new text frame which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified location relative to the paragraph it is anchored to and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored text frame are moved with the text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.addAtFixedPositionInDocument
member.summary: Creates and inserts a new text frame which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a location relative to the top left corner of the complete document. All gaps between the pages must be included.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.addAtFixedPositionOnPage
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.addInline
member.summary: Inserts a text frame inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The text frame is inserted at the specified text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.addWithMouse
member.summary: Inserts a text frame with the built-in mouse interface. The text frame's size is determined through the end-user. A cross cursor indicates where the text frame can be inserted. Changing the document aborts the insertion process.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.getItem
member.summary: Gets the text frame selected by the user or the text frame with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.getItemByName
member.summary: Gets the text frame with the specified name.

member.summary: Removes a text frame from a Text Control document.

member.summary: Represents a part of the document, which can be the main text, a header or footer or a text frame.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextPart.addSubTextPart
member.summary: Obsolete. This method will be removed in one of the next versions. Inserts a new SubTextPart into the TextPart at the current input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextPart.addTextField
member.summary: Obsolete. This method will be removed in one of the next versions. Inserts a new ApplicationField or TextField into the TextPart at the current input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextPart.getSubTextParts
member.summary: Obsolete. This method will be removed in one of the next versions. Requests a collection of either all subtextparts the current text part contains or only the subtextpart containing the input position from the server and returns the collection by calling a callback function which has to be provided as a parameter to the function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextPart.getTextFields
member.summary: Obsolete. This method will be removed in one of the next versions. Requests a collection of either all text fields in the text part or only the text field containing the input position from the server and returns the collection by calling a callback function which has to be provided as a parameter to the function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextPart.removeSubTextPart
member.summary: Obsolete. This method will be removed in one of the next versions. Removes a SubTextPart from the TextPart.

member.summary: The tab is positioned right most and the text is diplayed at the left of this position. The tab position set with the TabPositions property is ignored. Only one tab of this kind is possible in a paragraph.

member.summary: Determines how the tab gap is filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TabLeader.None
member.summary: The tab gap is not filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TabLeader.Period
member.summary: The tab gap is filled with periods.

member.summary: The tab gap is filled with dots.

member.summary: The tab gap is underlined.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode
member.summary: Determines how the frame of an image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing can be inserted in the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter
member.summary: The frame is inserted in the text as a single character.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.DisplaceCompleteLines
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text stops at the top and continues at the bottom of the frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.DisplaceText
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text flows around the frame and empty areas at the left and right side are filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.AboveTheText
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location above the text. This means that the frame overwrites the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.BelowTheText
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location below the text. This means that the text overwrites the frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText
member.summary: The frame is anchored to a paragraph and moved with the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage
member.summary: The frame is fixed positioned on a page.

member.summary: Specifies a barcode.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.Chart
member.summary: Specifies a chart.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.HTMLFormat

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.PlainText

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.RichTextFormat

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.TXTextControlFormat

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.TXTextControlTextframe
member.summary: Specifies a TX Text Control textframe including its contents. The clipbord contains also information about how the textframe is positioned in the document (inline or geometrically positioned).

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Direction
member.summary: Determines the writing direction of a paragraph.

member.summary: The writing direction is left to right, which means that blocks of text with left to right and right to left characters are ordered from left to right.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Direction.RightToLeft
member.summary: The writing direction is right to left, which means that blocks of text with left to right and right to left characters are ordered from right to left.

member.summary: All letters are changed to uppercase.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CapitalizationSettings.ToggleCase

member.summary: The object is a header. When an even header exists, the object represents the odd header. Otherwise it represents the header of all pages.

member.summary: The object represents a special header of the document's or section's first page.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.Footer

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.FirstPageFooter
member.summary: The object represents a special footer of the document's or section's first page.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.EvenHeader
member.summary: The object represents an even header.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.EvenFooter
member.summary: The object represents an even footer.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Left
member.summary: The alignment is left aligned.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Right
member.summary: The alignment right aligned.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Center
member.summary: The alignment is centered.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Justify
member.summary: The alignment is justified. This value is only used with text. It cannot be used with text frames, images and charts.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode
member.summary: Determines how an Image can be inserted in the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.AsCharacter
member.summary: The image is inserted in the text as a single character.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.DisplaceCompleteLines
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text stops at the top and continues at the bottom of the image.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.DisplaceText
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text flows around the image and empty areas at the left and right side are filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.AboveTheText
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location above the text. This means that the image overwrites the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.BelowTheText
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location below the text. This means that the text overwrites the image.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.MoveWithText
member.summary: The image is anchored to a paragraph and moved with the text. This member cannot be used with the ImageCollection.Add methods.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.FixedOnPage
member.summary: The image is fixed positioned on a page. This member cannot be used with the ImageCollection.Add methods.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.PageContent

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PageContent.All
member.summary: The image contains all parts without the screen elements.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PageContent.Background
member.summary: The image contains the background of the page.

member.summary: The image contains the header and the footer of the page.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PageContent.MainText
member.summary: The image contains the page's text contents.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PageContent.ScreenElements

member.name: T:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings
member.summary: Specifies how the document structure is generated when a PDF document is imported.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.GenerateLines
member.summary: Text only,images and paragraph formatting are discarded. This option is best suited for searching PDF files.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.GenerateParagraphs
member.summary: Generates paragraphs from the text flow. Images are discarded.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.GenerateTextFrames
member.summary: Default. Uses tables, images and text frames to create a document that best matches the original document's appearance.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.GenerateTextFramesFirstPageOnly
member.summary: Same as GenerateTextFrames, but only the first page is loaded. Can be used for previewing the document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.GenerateXML
member.summary: Obsolete. This setting will be removed in a future version. Use LoadEmbeddedData instead.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.LoadEmbeddedData
member.summary: Provides the PDF document's metadata, form fields and text coordinates through the LoadSettings.EmbeddedData property.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PDFImportSettings.LoadEmbeddedFiles
member.summary: Default. Files embedded in the PDF document are loaded and provided through the LoadSettings.EmbeddedFiles property.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.EmbeddedDataFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of additionally provided data when a PDF document is imported.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.EmbeddedDataFormat.FormFields
member.summary: Specifies an XML format with information about the position and the kind of all form fields contained in the PDF document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.EmbeddedDataFormat.MetaData
member.summary: Specifies the PDF document's metadata.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.EmbeddedDataFormat.TextCoordinates
member.summary: Specifies an XML format where each line of text has attributes such as page number and geometrical position.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar

member.summary: Shows the control character of a space.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.Tab
member.summary: Shows the control character of a tabstop.

member.summary: Shows the control character for the end of a paragraph.

member.summary: Shows the control character of a forced line break.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.ForcedPageBreak
member.summary: Marks a forced page break.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.SectionBreak
member.summary: Marks a section break.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.Hyphen
member.summary: Shows the control character of a hyphen.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.NonBreakingSpace
member.summary: Shows the control character of a non-breaking space.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.TableCellEnd
member.summary: Shows the control character for the end of a table cell.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.PermanentControlChar.Pagination
member.summary: Shows a dot in front of the first line of a paragraph with one of the pagination settings 'keep with next', 'page break before' and 'keep lines together'.

member.summary: Shows the overflow symbol when text does not fit in a textframe.

member.summary: The section begins on the next line with a new paragraph.

member.summary: The section begins on the next page with a new paragraph.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.StreamType
member.summary: Determines a certain text format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.AdobePDF
member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format (PDF). How a PDF document is loaded depends on the LoadSettings.PDFImportSettings property. Only a complete document can be saved with this format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.AdobePDFA
member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format Archive (PDF/A). This format can only be used in saving operations and only a complete document can be saved with this format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.AllFormats
member.summary: Specifies whether an 'All Formats' item is added to the Load dialog. Selecting that item displayes all files that can be chosen by the dialog.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.CascadingStylesheet
member.summary: Specifies CSS format (Cascading Style Sheet). This format can only be used in saving operations.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.HTMLFormat
member.summary: Specifies HTML format (Hypertext Markup Language).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.InternalFormat
member.summary: Specifies the Text Control format. Text is stored in ANSI format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.InternalUnicodeFormat
member.summary: Specifies the Text Control format. Text is stored in Unicode format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.MSWord
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format (.DOC version).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.PlainAnsiText
member.summary: Specifies text in Windows ANSI format (an end of a paragraph is marked with the control characters 13 and 10).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.PlainText
member.summary: Specifies text in Windows Unicode format (an end of a paragraph is marked with the control characters 13 and 10).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.RichTextFormat
member.summary: Specifies RTF format (Rich Text Format).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.SpreadsheetML
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Excel format (Office Open XML version).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.WordprocessingML
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format (Office Open XML version).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.XMLFormat
member.summary: Specifies XML format (Extensible Markup Language).

member.name: T:TXTextControl.StringStreamType
member.summary: Determines a certain text format that can be stored as a string.

member.summary: Specifies CSS format (Cascading Style Sheet). This format can only be used in saving operations.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.HTMLFormat
member.summary: Specifies HTML format (Hypertext Markup Language).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.PlainText
member.summary: Specifies Text in Windows Unicode format (an end of a paragraph is marked with the control characters 13 and 10).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.RichTextFormat
member.summary: Specifies RTF format (Rich Text Format).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.XMLFormat
member.summary: Specifies XML format (Extensible Markup Language).

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TableAddPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position where to add table rows and columns or where to split a table.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TableAddPosition.Before
member.summary: Table rows or columns are inserted or the table is split in front of the row or column with the current input position.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TableAddPosition.After
member.summary: Table rows or columns are inserted or the table is split behind the row or column with the current input position.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition
member.summary: Specifies special text input positions at the beginning and the end of a TextField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition.InsideTextField
member.summary: The specified position is inside the field.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition.OutsideTextField
member.summary: The specified position is outside the field.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition.InsideNextTextField
member.summary: The specified position is inside the next field. This member is only possible, if there are two following text fields without any character bewteen the fields. In this case InsideTextField is in the first field, OutsideTextField is between the fields and InsideNextTextField is in the second field.

member.summary: Specifies types of text fields.

member.summary: The field type is ApplicationField.

member.summary: Specifies all types of FormFields.

member.summary: The field type is HypertextLink.

member.summary: The field type is DocumentLink.

member.summary: The field type is PageNumberField.

member.summary: The field type is SelectionFormField.

member.summary: The field type is TextFormField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldType.All
member.summary: Specifies all types of text fields.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode
member.summary: Determines how a TextFrame can be inserted in the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter
member.summary: The text frame is inserted in the text as a single character.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.DisplaceCompleteLines
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text stops at the top and continues at the bottom of the text frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.DisplaceText
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text flows around the text frame and empty areas at the left and right side are filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.AboveTheText
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location above the text. This means that the text frame overwrites the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.BelowTheText
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location below the text. This means that the text overwrites the text frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText
member.summary: The text frame is anchored to a paragraph and moved with the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage
member.summary: The text frame is fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ZoomOption
member.summary: Specifies options how to set the zoom factor of a TextControl.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZoomOption.PageWidth
member.summary: The zoom factor is calculated so that the complete width of a page becomes visible.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZoomOption.TextWidth
member.summary: The zoom factor is calculated so that the complete text of a line becomes visible.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZoomOption.WholePage
member.summary: The zoom factor is calculated so that the current visible page becomes completely visible.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ZOrder
member.summary: Specifies how the z-order of a frame (image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing) can be changed.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Bottom
member.summary: If the frame is in front of the text, it becomes the bottommost of all objects in front of the text. If it is behind the text, it is becomes the bottommost of all objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.BottomMost
member.summary: The frame is moved behind the text below all other objects. This member is only possible, if the insertion mode is BehindTheText.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Down
member.summary: The frame is moved down one plane. If it is the bottommost object in front of the text, it is not moved behind the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.TopMost
member.summary: The frame is moved in front of the text at the top of all other objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Top
member.summary: If the frame is behind the text, it becomes the topmost of all objects behind the text. If it is in front of the text, it becomes the topmost of all objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Up
member.summary: The frame is moved up one plane. If it is the topmost object behind the text, it is not moved in front of the text.

member.summary: Inserts a new object of the type ApplicationField at the current input position.

member.summary: Removes all fields of the type ApplicationField from a TX Text Control document.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.

Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.summary: Removes a field of the type ApplicationField including its visible text from a TX Text Control document.

member.summary: Removes a field of the type ApplicationField from a TX Text Control document. The visible text is deleted depending on the keepText parameter.

Specifies the DocumentTarget to edit.

If the length of the commented text is zero, the current text selection is used to define the text associated with the comment.
