member.name: T:TXTextControl.Condition
member.summary: An object of the Condition class is an element of the ConditionalInstruction class and represents the state of a FormField that has to be fulfilled to execute the instructions of the related ConditionalInstruction object.To create a condition, the Condition object has to be initialized with a FormField that is located inside the document.Furthermore, a comparison value has to be defined by the constructor's comparisonValue parameter.• The constructor's isChecked parameter value of a condition that references to a CheckFormField represents a check state to be fulfilled.• Conditions that are related to form fields of type TextFormField or SelectionFormField execute a comparison to the form field's Text property value.• In addition, the text of a SelectionFormField object can be compared with one of its SelectionFormField.Items array entries or checked whether or not the string equals to one of its SelectionFormField.Items array entries.• Up to four different comparison types can be applied to compare the Date property of DateFormField objects with a specified value: If the comparison value is an object of type System.DateTime, the year, month and day of month is compared with the current property value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Condition.#ctor(TXTextControl.CheckFormField,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that tests whether the CheckFormField's Checked property value equals the specified boolean value. The Condition.ComparisonValueType property is set to ComparisonValueTypes.CheckState.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the value that the CheckFormField.Checked property must have to fulfill the condition.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Condition.#ctor(TXTextControl.TextFormField,Condition.ComparisonOperators,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the TextFormField's Text property with the specified string value. If that value is null or an empty string, the condition's comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.NoValue. Otherwise as ComparisonValueTypes.CustomText.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Condition.#ctor(TXTextControl.TextFormField,Condition.ComparisonOperators,System.String,Condition.TextComparisonFlags)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the TextFormField's Text property with the specified string value. The textComparisonFlag parameter determines whether the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.CustomText or ComparisonValueTypes.Regex. If the comparisonValue parameter is null or an empty string, a System.ArgumentException is thrown.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.
Determines whether the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.CustomText or ComparisonValueTypes.Regex.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the SelectionFormField's Text property with the specified string value. If that value is null or an empty string, the condition's comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.NoValue.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Condition.#ctor(TXTextControl.SelectionFormField,Condition.ComparisonOperators,System.String,Condition.TextComparisonFlags)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the SelectionFormField's Text property with the specified string value. The textComparisonFlag parameter determines whether the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.CustomText or ComparisonValueTypes.Regex. If the comparisonValue parameter is null or an empty string, a System.ArgumentException is thrown.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.
Determines whether the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.CustomText or ComparisonValueTypes.Regex.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Condition.#ctor(TXTextControl.SelectionFormField,Condition.ComparisonOperators,System.String,Condition.ItemComparisonFlags)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the SelectionFormField's Text property with the specified string value. The itemComparisonFlag parameter determines whether the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.AnyItem or ComparisonValueTypes.SpecificItem. If the itemComparisonFlag parameter is set to ItemComparisonFlags.SpecificItem and the comparisonValue parameter is null, an empty string or not an element of the SelectionFormField.Items collection, a System.ArgumentException is thrown.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.
Determines whether the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.AnyItem or ComparisonValueTypes.SpecificItem.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the DateFormField's Date property with the specified System.DateTime value. If that value is null, the condition's comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.NoValue. Otherwise as ComparisonValueTypes.Date.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Condition.#ctor(TXTextControl.DateFormField,Condition.ComparisonOperators,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Condition class that compares the DateFormField's Date property with the specified integer value. If that value is greater than 1600 and less than 10000, the condition's comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.Year. If the value is a positive number between 1 and 31, the comparison value is interpreted as ComparisonValueTypes.DayOfMonth. For all other integer values a System.ArgumentException is thrown.
member.param: Specifies the form field whose property value is to be compared with the condition's comparison value.
Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.

Specifies the operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value.
Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.

Specifies the value that is compared with the condition's form field value.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators
member.summary: Determines the comparison operator that is used to compare the condition's form field value with the specified comparison value or the interpretation of that value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.Is
member.summary: Form field value equals to the specified comparison value or the interpretation of that value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.IsNot
member.summary: Form field value does not equal to the specified comparison value or the interpretation of that value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.Contains
member.summary: Form field value contains the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.StartsWith
member.summary: Form field value starts with the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.EndsWith
member.summary: Form field value ends with the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.DoesNotContain
member.summary: Form field value does not contain the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.DoesNotStartWith
member.summary: Form field value does not start with the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.DoesNotEndWith
member.summary: Form field value does not end with the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThan
member.summary: Form field value is greater than the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: Form field value is greater than or equals to the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.IsLessThan
member.summary: Form field value is less than the specified comparison value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonOperators.IsLessThanOrEqual
member.summary: Form field value is less than or equals to the specified comparison value.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes
member.summary: Determines how the condition's comparison value is interpreted by the condition.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.CheckState
member.summary: The condition tests the check state of the related condition's CheckFormField. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property is set to true. The Condition.ComparisonOperator returns the enumeration value ComparisonOperators.Is, if the condition checks whether the check form field is checked. Otherwise ComparisonOperators.IsNot.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.NoValue
member.summary: The condition examines whether the related condition's FormField property does not provide a suitable value that can be used for comparison. Form field values of type TextFormField and SelectionFormField are not suitable for comparison, if their FormField.Text property value is an empty string. The corresponding value of a DateFormField cannot be compared, if its DateFormField.Date property returns null. If the ComparisonValueTypes.NoValue value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property is set to null. The ComparisonValueTypes.NoValue enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is or ComparisonOperators.IsNot.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.CustomText
member.summary: The condition compares the FormField.Text property value of the related condition's TextFormField or SelectionFormField with the value of the Condition.ComparisonValue property. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property value is an object of type string. Furthermore, all provided values of the ComparisonOperators enumeration can be set as Condition.ComparisonOperator property value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.Regex
member.summary: The condition checks whether or not the FormField.Text property value of the related condition's TextFormField or SelectionFormField matches a specific regular expression. That regular expression is represented by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. It is an object of type string and conforms to the rules of the .NET Framework regular expression engine. The ComparisonValueTypes.Regex enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is or ComparisonOperators.IsNot.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.SpecificItem
member.summary: The condition compares the FormField.Text property value of the related condition's SelectionFormField with an item of SelectionFormField.Items string array collection. The representation of that item is an object of type string, which is specified by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. All provided values of the ComparisonOperators enumeration can be set as Condition.ComparisonOperator property value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.AnyItem
member.summary: The condition examines whether the related condition's SelectionFormField.Text property value matches one of the SelectionFormField.Items string array collection values. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property is set to null. The ComparisonValueTypes.AnyItem enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is or ComparisonOperators.IsNot.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.Date
member.summary: The condition compares the DateFormField.Date property value of the related condition's DateFormField with a date that is specified by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property is an object of type System.DateTime. The ComparisonValueTypes.Date enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is, ComparisonOperators.IsNot,ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThan, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThanOrEqual, ComparisonOperators.IsLessThan or ComparisonOperators.IsLessThanOrEqual.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.Year
member.summary: The condition compares the DateFormField.Date property value of the related condition's DateFormField with a year that is specified by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property represents an integer between 1601 and 9999. The ComparisonValueTypes.Year enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is, ComparisonOperators.IsNot, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThan, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThanOrEqual, ComparisonOperators.IsLessThan or ComparisonOperators.IsLessThanOrEqual.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.Month
member.summary: The condition compares the DateFormField.Date property value of the related condition's DateFormField with a month that is specified by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValueproperty is an object of type Condition.Month. The ComparisonValueTypes.Month enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is, ComparisonOperators.IsNot, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThan, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThanOrEqual, ComparisonOperators.IsLessThan or ComparisonOperators.IsLessThanOrEqual.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.DayOfMonth
member.summary: The condition compares the DateFormField.Date property value of the related condition's DateFormField with a day of the month that is specified by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property represents an integer between 1 and 31. The ComparisonValueTypes.DayOfMonth enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is, ComparisonOperators.IsNot, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThan, ComparisonOperators.IsGreaterThanOrEqual, ComparisonOperators.IsLessThan or ComparisonOperators.IsLessThanOrEqual.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ComparisonValueTypes.Weekday
member.summary: The condition compares the DateFormField.Date property value of the related condition's DateFormField with a weekday that is specified by the Condition.ComparisonValue property. If this enumeration value is returned by the Condition.ComparisonValueType property, the Condition.ComparisonValue property is an object of type System.DayOfWeek. The ComparisonValueTypes.Weekday enumeration value can only be combined with the operator ComparisonOperators.Is or ComparisonOperators.IsNot.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Condition.ItemComparisonFlags
member.summary: Determines how the specified comparison value has to be interpreted when comparing it with the SelectionFormField's Text property.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ItemComparisonFlags.SpecificItem
member.summary: The comparison value represents an item of the SelectionFormField.Items array.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.ItemComparisonFlags.AnyItem
member.summary: The condition checks whether or not the SelectionFormField's Text property value equals to one of its items.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Condition.LogicalConnectives
member.summary: Determines how the condition is related to the previous condition inside the corresponding ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array.

member.summary: The condition is connected to the previous condition by a logical conjunction (ConditionA ∧ ConditionB)

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Condition.LogicalConnectives.Or
member.summary: The condition is connected to the previous condition by a logical disjunction (ConditionA ∨ ConditionB)

member.summary: The editable region wasn't inserted because the selection is too complex. It is not a continuous sequence of characters.

member.summary: The editable region has successfully been inserted.

member.summary: Unspecified internal error.

member.summary: The file contains not well-formed syntax.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterCollection
member.summary: An instance of the HeaderFooterCollection class contains the headers and footers in a Text Control document represented through objects of the type HeaderFooter.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterCollection.Add(TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType)
member.summary: Adds a new header or footer to a Text Control document or to a certain section of the document. If a header or footer is added to the complete document the first section receives the header or footer and all other sections receive headers or footers which are connected to their previous section. To add more than one header or footer a combination of the HeaderFooterType enumeration values can be used.
member.param: Specifies the headers and/or footers to add.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ImageCollection
member.summary: An instance of the ImageCollection class contains all images in a Text Control document or part of the document represented through objects of the type Image.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add
member.summary: Inserts an image inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The image is inserted at the current text input position. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts an image inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The image is inserted at the specified text input position. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the text position at which the image is to be inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified horizontal alignment and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored images are moved with the text. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the image's horizontal alignment.
Specifies the text position at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified location relative to the paragraph it is anchored to and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored images are moved with the text. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies the text position at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the number of a page beginning with 1 where the image is located.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a location relative to the top left corner of the complete document. All gaps between the pages must be included. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Instruction
member.summary: An object of the Instruction class is an element of the ConditionalInstruction class and represents actions that are execute´d when the corresponding conditions are fulfilled.To specify such an instruction, the Instruction object has to be initialized with a FormField that is located inside the document.In this context, up to four different types of actions can be executed: Changing the FormField.Enabled property, marking the form field value as valid or invalid, setting a new value and replacing the SelectionFormField.Items array with another string array.To specify a value that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled, the constructor's instructionValue parameter must be used.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Instruction.#ctor(TXTextControl.FormField,Instruction.InstructionTypes,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Instruction class to determine the executing action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled. Using this overload, by default, no else instruction is applied when the corresponding conditions are not fulfilled. Accordingly, the Instruction.IsElseInstructionEnabled property is set to false and the Instruction.ElseInstructionValue property value returns the instruction type depending default value.
member.param: Specifies the form field to which the specified action is executed.
Specifies the type of the action to perfom.

Specifies the desired value that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled.The type of the instructionValue parameter depends on the Instruction.InstructionTypes enumeration value that is specified by the instructionType parameter and, in case Instruction.InstructionTypes.SetValue is set, the related form field type:

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Instruction.#ctor(TXTextControl.FormField,Instruction.InstructionTypes,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Instruction class to determine the executing actions when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled or not fulfilled. Apart from the instructionValue parameter value, that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled, an else instruction value must be specified. It is set if the corresponding condtitions are not fulfilled. On using this overload, the Instruction.IsElseInstructionEnabled property is set to true and the Instruction.ElseInstructionValue property represents the set else instruction value.
member.param: Specifies the form field to which the specified action is executed.
Specifies the type of the action to perfom.

Specifies the desired value that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled.The type of the instructionValue parameter depends on the Instruction.InstructionTypes enumeration value that is specified by the instructionType parameter and, in case Instruction.InstructionTypes.SetValue is set, the related form field type:

Specifies the desired value that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are not fulfilled.The type of the elseInstructionValue parameter depends on the Instruction.InstructionTypes enumeration value that is specified by the instructionType parameter and, in case Instruction.InstructionTypes.SetValue is set, the related form field type:

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionTypes
member.summary: Determines the type of action to execute.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionTypes.IsEnabled
member.summary: The instruction sets the FormField.Enabled property to true or false. This enumeration value is used in combination with an instruction value of type boolean that represents the new desired FormField.Enabled value.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionTypes.IsValueValid
member.summary: The instruction marks the form field value as valid or invalid. This enumeration value is used in combination with an instruction value of type boolean. To retrieve the result of an instruction with that instruction type, the ConditionalInstructionCollection.IsValueValid method is provided.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionTypes.SetValue
member.summary: The instruction sets a new value to a FormField type specific property. If the related FormField is an object of type CheckFormField, the instruction type is used in combination with an instruction value of type boolean that represents the new desired CheckFormField.Checked property value. At form fields of type TextFormField and SelectionFormField, the Text property is updated with a string value. The corresponding property of date form fields is the DateFormField.Date property. To update that property, the Instruction.InstructionValue property needs a value of type System.DateTime.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionTypes.SetItems
member.summary: The instruction replaces the SelectionFormField.Items array with the string array that is represented by Instruction.InstructionValue property.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.ElseInstructionValue
member.summary: Gets the value that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are not fulfilled and the Instruction.IsElseInstructionEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.FormField
member.summary: Gets the FormField to which the specified action is executed.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionType
member.summary: Gets the type of action to execute.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.InstructionValue
member.summary: Gets the value that is set by the specified action when the defined requirements of the ConditionalInstruction.Conditions array are fulfilled.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.IsElseInstructionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this Instruction allows to execute else instructions.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.IsFormFieldChangeInstruction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this Instruction listens to value changes of the related conditions' form fields.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Instruction.IsInitialInstruction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this Instruction is handled when the document is initialized as a form.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.Number
member.summary: Gets the number of this misspelled word.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.Start
member.summary: Gets the starting position of a misspelled word.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWord.Text
member.summary: Gets the text of the misspelled word.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection
member.summary: An instance of the MisspelledWordCollection class contains all misspelled words in the main part of a Text Control document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.
member.param: Specifies the array to copy to.
Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetCount(TXTextControl.MisspelledWordKind)
member.summary: Returns the number of misspelled words with a special meaning from the collection.
member.param: Specifies the word's kind.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at the current text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word between the current input position and the end of the text, the first word is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(TXTextControl.MisspelledWordKind)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word of the specified kind at the current text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word of is returned. If there is no misspelled word of the specified kind between the current input position and the end of the text, the first word of the specified kind is returned.
member.param: Specifies the word's kind.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at a certain geometrical location. If there is no misspelled word, null is returned.
member.param: Specifies the word's location.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at the specified text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word between the specified input position and the end of the text, the first word is returned.
member.param: Specifies a zero-based text postion.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(System.Int32,TXTextControl.MisspelledWordKind)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word of the specified kind at the specified text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word of the specified kind between the specified input position and the end of the text, the first word of the specified kind is returned.
member.param: Specifies a zero-based text postion.
Specifies the word's kind.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Ignore(TXTextControl.MisspelledWord,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the text of the specified misspelled word and marks it as ignored. Ignored misspelled words are not underlined with a red zigzag line.
member.param: Specifies the misspelled word to change.
Specifies the changed text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.MisspelledWord)
member.summary: Removes the specified misspelled word from a Text Control document. The method removes the word's reference in the list of misspelled words, but not the word's text in the document.
member.param: Specifies the misspelled word to remove.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.MisspelledWord,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified misspelled word from a Text Control document. The method removes the word's reference in the list of misspelled words and replaces the word's text with the specified text.
member.param: Specifies the misspelled word to remove.
Specifies the corrected text.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the collection.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Item
member.summary: Gets a misspelled word from the collection.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Page
member.summary: An object of the Page class represents a formatted page of a document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Page.GetImage(TXTextControl.PageContent)
member.summary: Gets an image of the page's contents as an enhanced metafile.
member.param: Specifies the image's contents.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Page.GetImage(System.Int32,TXTextControl.PageContent)
member.summary: Gets an image of the page's contents as a bitmap in screen resolution.
member.param: Specifies a zooming factor in percent.
Specifies the image's contents.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Page.GetImage(TXTextControl.PageContent,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an image of the page's contents as a string in Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) format. All characters are contained with outline curve data that are cubic Bézier splines. Curve and line data coordinates are in twentieth of a point (twips). Images of all pixel-formats are embedded in Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format.
member.param: Specifies the image's contents.
Specifies a maximum resolution value, in dots per inch, for images in pixel-formats.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SaveSettings
member.summary: The SaveSettings class provides properties for advanced settings and information during save operations.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DialogSettings
member.summary: Determines additional options in a file Save As... dialogbox.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DialogSettings.None
member.summary: The dialogbox does not show additional options.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DialogSettings.EnterPassword
member.summary: PDF only: The dialogbox offers a button which opens a dialogbox to specify an encryption password. This button is shown only, if the user selects Adobe PDF as the file format to save the document. The Adobe PDF/A file format does not support encryption passwords.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DialogSettings.StylesheetOptions
member.summary: HTML only: The dialogbox offers buttons to specify how to save formatting styles: Inline or in a separate file. These buttons are shown only, if the user selects Hypertext Markup Language as the file format to save the document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DialogSettings.SaveSelection
member.summary: The dialogbox offers a checkbox indicating that only the currently selected text is saved. This checkbox is shown only, if a text selection exists when the dialogbox is opened.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.Author
member.summary: Sets the document's author which will be saved in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.BytesWritten
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes written during a save operation.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CreationDate
member.summary: Sets the document's creation date which will be saved in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CreatorApplication
member.summary: Sets the application, which has created the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssFileName
member.summary: HTML only. Sets the path and filename of a CSS file belonging to a HTML document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.CssSaveMode
member.summary: HTML only. Specifies how to save stylesheet data with a HTML document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DigitalSignature
member.summary: Specifies a DigitalSignature object, which defines an X.509 certificate.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DocumentAccessPermissions
member.summary: Specifies how a document can be accessed after it has been opened.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DocumentKeywords
member.summary: Sets the document's keywords which will be saved in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DocumentLevelJavaScriptActions
member.summary: Specifies an array of strings containing Javascript.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DocumentSubject
member.summary: Sets the document's subject string which will be saved in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.DocumentTitle
member.summary: Sets the document's title that will be saved in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ImageCompressionQuality
member.summary: Sets a value between 1 and 100, which is the quality of a lossy image compression used when a document is saved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ImageExportFilterIndex
member.summary: Sets the format used for saving all images contained in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ImageMaxResolution
member.summary: Sets the maximum resolution for all images in the document in dots per inch when the document is saved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ImageSaveMode
member.summary: Determines whether the document's images are stored through its data or through its file reference.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.ImageSavePath
member.summary: Sets a file path that is used to save resources like images when images are saved as file link.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.LastModificationDate
member.summary: Sets the date the document is last modified.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.OmittedContent
member.summary: Specifies data to be omitted when the document is saved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.PageMargins
member.summary: Sets the margins saved for the document's pages.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.PageSize
member.summary: Sets the width and height saved for the document's pages.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.SavedFile
member.summary: Read only. Gets the name and path of the file that has been saved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.SaveDocumentBackColor
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the document background color is saved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.SavedStreamType
member.summary: Read only. Gets the StreamType of the file that has been saved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.SignatureFields
member.summary: Specifies an array of DigitalSignature objects, each of which defines an X.509 certificate and is associated with a SignatureField in the document.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SaveSettings.UserDefinedDocumentProperties
member.summary: Sets a dictionary with all user-defined document properties which will be saved in the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SectionCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SectionBreakKind)
member.summary: Adds a new section at the current text input position. The new section ends at the end position of the section containing the input position. If a new section is inserted in a paragraph or table, the paragraph or table is split into two paragraphs or tables.
member.param: Specifies the kind of the section break.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SectionCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SectionBreakKind,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new section at the specified text input position. The new section ends at the end position of the section containing the input position. If a new section is inserted in a paragraph or table, the paragraph or table is split into two paragraphs or tables.
member.param: Specifies the kind of the section break.
Specifies the text position at which the section is to be inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SectionFormat.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])

Specifies the widths of the columns.
Specifies the distances between the columns.

member.summary: Specifies that the dialog box has been canceled.

member.summary: Specifies that the dialog box has been left with the Escape key.

member.summary: Specifies that the dialog box has been left with OK.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.ChangeCapitalization(TXTextControl.CapitalizationSettings)
member.summary: Changes the capitalization of all selected characters depending on the settings parameter.
member.param: Specifies how the capitalization is changed.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.ChangeDirection(TXTextControl.Direction)
member.summary: Changes the writing direction of all selected paragraphs. When the direction of a paragraph is changed, this paragraph's alignment is toggled from left to right or from right to left. The alignment of centered and justified paragraphs is not changed. Left and right tabulators are also toggled.
member.param: Specifies the writing direction.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.DecreaseIndent
member.summary: Decreases the left indent of all paragraphs contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method decreases the left indent at the text input position. Left indent positions are defined through the paragraphs' tab positions and the indents of the paragraphs in front and behind the paragraph with the text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.GrowFont
member.summary: Increases the font size of each font contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method increases the font size at the text input position. The font sizes used with this method are the same as shown through the ButtonBar or the built-in font dialog.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IncreaseIndent
member.summary: Increases the left indent of all paragraphs contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method increases the left indent at the text input position. left indent positions are defined through the paragraphs' tab positions and the indents of the paragraphs in front and behind the paragraph with the text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(Selection.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the Selection.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the enumeration.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(ParagraphFormat.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the ParagraphFormat.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the enumeration.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(ListFormat.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the ListFormat.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the enumeration.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(SectionFormat.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the SectionFormat.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the enumeration.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(PageMargins.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the PageMargins.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the enumeration.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.RemoveFormatting
member.summary: Resets all character based formatting attributes of the selected text to its default values. If nothing or more than one paragraph is selected, all paragraph based formatting attributes are also reset.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.RemoveInlineStyles
member.summary: Removes all character based styles of the selected text so that all attributes are reset to the attributes of the paragraph style.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.ShrinkFont
member.summary: Decreases the font size of each font contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method decreases the font size at the text input position. The font sizes used with this method are the same as shown through the ButtonBar or the built-in font dialog.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.GetSupportedFonts
member.summary: Gets an array of strings specifying the names of all currently supported fonts. These fonts depend on the formatting device set with the ServerTextControl.FormattingPrinter property. The method returns null if the ServerTextControl has not been completely initialized.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.GetSupportedPaperSizes
member.summary: Gets an array of PaperSize structures specifying the names and the size of all currently supported paper sizes. These paper sizes depend on the formatting device set with the ServerTextControl.FormattingPrinter property. The method returns null, if the ServerTextControl has not been completely initialized.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetBackColor
member.summary: Resets the BackColor property to its default value. The default value is the system color for the window background.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetContents
member.summary: Deletes the entire contents of the control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetFont
member.summary: Resets the Font property to its default value. The default value is 10 pt Arial.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetForeColor
member.summary: Resets the ForeColor property to its default value. The default value is the system color for the window text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetPageMargins
member.summary: Resets the PageMargins property to its default value. The default page margins are 1 inch.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetPageSize
member.summary: Resets the PageSize property to its default value. The default page size is US letter (8,5 x 11 inch).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerTextControl.ResetTextBackColor
member.summary: Resets the TextBackColor property to its default value. The default value is the setting of the BackColor property.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SignatureField
member.summary: An instance of the SignatureField class represents a signature field in a Text Control document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureField.#ctor(System.Drawing.Size,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SignatureField class. A name is necessary when the signature field is associated with a digital certificate.
member.param: Specifies the signature field's size in twips.
Specifies the signature field's name.
Specifies the signature field's user-defined id.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SignatureField.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets a SignatureImage.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SignatureField.SignerData
member.summary: Gets or sets a suggested signer's name, title and address and a reason why to sign the document.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection
member.summary: An instance of the SignatureFieldCollection class contains all signature fields in a Text Control document represented through objects of the type SignatureField.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SignatureField,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a signature field inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The field is inserted at the specified text position.
member.param: Specifies the signature field to add.
Specifies the text position at which the signature field is to be inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SignatureField,TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a signature field which is anchored to the paragraph containing the specified text position. The field has the specified horizontal alignment. FrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage and FrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the signature field to add.
Specifies the signature field's horizontal alignment.
Specifies the text position at which the signature field is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SignatureField,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a signature field which is anchored to the paragraph containing the specified text position. The field has the specified position relative to the paragraph containing its anchor position. FrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage and FrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the signature field to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the signature field is to be inserted.
Specifies the text position at which the signature field is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SignatureField,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a signature field that has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page. FrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText and FrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the signature field to add.
Specifies the number of a page beginning with 1 where the signature field is located.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the signature field is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SignatureField,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a signature field that has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This location is specified through a document position relative to the top left corner of the complete document. FrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText and FrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the signature field to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the signature field is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SignatureFieldCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SignatureField,TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a signature field with the built-in mouse interface. The signature field's size is determined through the end-user. A cross cursor indicates where the signature field can be inserted. Changing the document or pressing the ESC key aborts the insertion process.
member.param: Specifies the signature field to add.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.
member.param: Specifies the array to copy to.
Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection
member.summary: Contains all subtextparts in the main text or another main part of a document.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult
member.summary: Specifies the result when a subtextpart has been added to the document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.AlreadyExists
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because it already exists.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Combined
member.summary: The subtextpart was inserted and combined with an existing one. A subtextpart is combined with an existing one, when it immediately follows it and has the same name and id.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Error
member.summary: An unexpected error has occurred.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.NoSelection
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because there is no selection.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Overlapping
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because it overlaps with an existing textpart.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.PositionInvalid
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because the specified position values are invalid. Invalid start and/or length values have been specified.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.SelectionTooComplex
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because the selection is too complex. It is not a continuous sequence of characters.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Successful
member.summary: The subtextpart has successfully been inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SubTextPart)
member.summary: Adds a new subtextpart to the document. Its position is defined through the SubTextPart.Start and SubTextPart.Length properties. If the subtextpart's length is zero, the current text selection is used to define the position.
member.param: Specifies the subtextpart to add.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.
member.param: Specifies the array to copy to.
Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetItem
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart at the current text input position. If there is more than one textpart at the current input position the textpart with the highest level is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart with the specified name. The method returns null, if such a textpart does not exist. If more than one textpart with this name exists, the first found textpart is returned.
member.param: Specifies the textpart's name set with the Name property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart with the specified id. The method returns null, if such a textpart does not exist. If more than one textpart with this id exists, the first found textpart is returned.
member.param: Specifies the textpart's identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.SubTextPart,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a subtextpart from the collection including all its nested subtextparts.
member.param: Specifies the subtextpart to remove.
If this parameter is set to true, the subtextpart is removed without deleting its visible text.
If this parameter is set to true, nested subtextparts are preserved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the collection.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Returns true if the collection is designed to be thread safe, otherwise, it returns false.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Item
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart with the specified number from the collection.

member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Table
member.summary: An instance of the Table class represents a table in a Text Control document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.MergeCells
member.summary: Merges all selected table cells in this table. The Table.CanMergeCells property can be used to determine, if table cells can be merged or not.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.Select
member.summary: Selects the complete table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects the part of the table defined through two table cells.
member.param: Specifies the row number where the selection begins.
Specifies the column number where the selection begins.
Specifies the row number where the selection ends.
Specifies the column number where the selection ends.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.Split(TXTextControl.TableAddPosition)
member.summary: Splits a table below or above the current input position. If the table does not contain the current input position it cannot be split. The Table.CanSplit property can be used to determine if a table can be split or not. If a table is split above the first row a new line is inserted above the table and if a table is split below the last row a new line is inserted below the table. This is useful to insert text above or below a nested table that immediately starts and/or ends at the beginning or the end of the cell in which it is nested.
member.param: Specifies the position where to split the table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.SplitCells
member.summary: Splits all selected table cells in this table. Only previously merged cells can be split. The Table.CanSplitCells property can be used to determine, if table cells can be split or not.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.CanMergeCells
member.summary: Checks whether table cells can be merged.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.CanSplit
member.summary: Checks whether this table can be split.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.CanSplitCells
member.summary: Returns true, if the currently selected table cells are merged.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TableOfContentsCollection.AddResult.ContentNotFound
member.summary: The table of contents could not be inserted or updated because it has no content. A paragraph with a structure level as specified through the TableOfContents.MinimumStructureLevel and TableOfContents.MaximumStructureLevel properties could not be found.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TableOfContentsCollection.AddResult.Error
member.summary: An unexpected error has occurred or the current text input position is a position where a table of contents cannot be inserted. Tables of content cannot be inserted in a TextField or a HypertextLink. Furthermore, tables of contents cannot be nested.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TableOfContentsCollection.AddResult.Successful
member.summary: The table of contents has successfully been inserted or updated.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetAutoControlSize
member.summary: Resets the AutoControlSize property to its default values. The default of the AutoControlSize property is a TextControl object that does not automatically expand or shrink its width or height.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetBackColor
member.summary: Overridden. Resets the BackColor property to its default value. The default value is the system color for the window background.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetContents
member.summary: Deletes the entire contents of a Text Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetCursor
member.summary: Overridden. Resets the Cursor property to its default value. The default value is the IBeam cursor.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetDisplayColors
member.summary: Resets all display colors of a text control to their system dependent default values.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetFieldCursor
member.summary: Resets the FieldCursor property to its default value. The default value is the Hand cursor.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetForeColor
member.summary: Overridden. Resets the ForeColor property to its default value. The default value is the system color for the window text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetPageMargins
member.summary: Resets the PageMargins property to its default value. The default page margins are 1 inch.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetPageSize
member.summary: Resets the PageSize property to its default value. The default page size is US letter (8,5 x 11 inch).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetTextBackColor
member.summary: Resets the TextBackColor property to its default value. The default value is the setting of the BackColor property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Save

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Save(TXTextControl.StreamType,TXTextControl.SaveSettings)

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.TableOfContentsDialog
member.summary: Invokes the built-in dialog box for inserting or changing a table of contents. If the current text input position is in an existing table of contents, the dialog box shows its attributes and the user can change it. Otherwise, a new table of contents is inserted with the specified attributes.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection
member.summary: An instance of the TextFrameCollection class contains all text frames in a Text Control document or part of the document represented through objects of the type TextFrame.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The frame is inserted at the specified text position.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the text position at which the text frame is to be inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame which is anchored to the paragraph containing the specified text position. The frame has the specified horizontal alignment. TextFrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the text frame's horizontal alignment.
Specifies the text position at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame which is anchored to the paragraph containing the specified text position. The frame has the specified position relative to the paragraph containing its anchor position. TextFrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies the text position at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame that has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page. TextFrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the number of a page beginning with 1 where the text frame is located.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame that has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This location is specified through a document position relative to the top left corner of the complete document. TextFrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame with the built-in mouse interface. The text frame's size is determined through the end-user. A cross cursor indicates where the text frame can be inserted. Changing the document or pressing the ESC key aborts the insertion process.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.
member.param: Specifies the array to copy to.
Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ThesaurusDialog
member.summary: The ThesaurusDialog class implements a Windows Forms dialog box that shows synonyms for selected text or a word at the current input position which will be selected on opening the dialog.Each item of the dialog box has a name, available through its Name property, which corresponds with a member of the ThesaurusDialog.DialogItem enumeration.To use this dialog the TextControl must be connected with an object of type TXSpellChecker (version 7.0 or higher).

member.summary: Gets the next or the previous change in the textflow. The search begins at the current text input position.
member.param: If this parameter is true, the next change in the textflow is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TrackedChangeCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.TrackedChange,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a tracked change from the collection. Depending on the accept parameter the change is either accepted or rejected. When a change is rejected, inserted text is removed and deleted text is reinserted.
member.param: Specifies the tracked change to remove.
When this parameter is true, the change is accepted, otherwise, it is rejected.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType
member.summary: Determines the type of barcode that is created by TX Barcode.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Code128
member.summary: Code128 is an alphanumeric barcode with high information density.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Interleaved2of5
member.summary: 2 of 5 is a barcode that encrypts digits only.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Code39
member.summary: 3 of 9 is a barcode that encrypts alphanumeric values.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.AztecCode
member.summary: AztecCode is a two-dimensional barcode that encrypts up to 1300 ASCII values.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.IntelligentMail
member.summary: Intelligent Mail barcode is a barcode type that encrypts postal zip codes and it the successor of Postnet.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.EAN13
member.summary: EAN 13 is a barcode that encrypts 13 digits and is used for marking retail goods.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.EAN8
member.summary: EAN 8 is derived from barcode type EAN13 and encrypts 8 digits.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.UPCA
member.summary: UPC-A barcode encrypts 12 digits and is very similar to EAN 13.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Postnet
member.summary: Postnet is a barcode type that encrypts postal zip codes.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.QRCode
member.summary: QR Code is a two-dimensional barcode that encrypts up to 1270 ASCII values or 1850 alphanumeric values. By design TX Barcode switches encryption mode when necessary.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Datamatrix
member.summary: Datamatrix is a two-dimensional barcode that encrypts up to 1301 ASCII values.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.PDF417
member.summary: PDF 417 is a two-dimensional barcode that encrypts up to 1500 ASCII values.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.MicroPDF
member.summary: MicroPDF is a two-dimensional barcode that encrypts up to 250 ASCII values.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar is a barcode that encrypts digits and the characters '-', '$', ':', '/', '.' and '+'.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.FourState
member.summary: 4State is a barcode that encrypts 8 digits.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Code11
member.summary: Code 11 is a barcode that encrypts up to 50 digits.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.Code93
member.summary: Code 93 is a barcode that encrypts alphanumeric values and the characters '.', '$', '/', '+', and '%'.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.PLANET
member.summary: PLANET is a barcode that encrypts digits.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Barcode.BarcodeType.RoyalMail
member.summary: Royal Mail is a barcode that encrypts alphanumeric characters and characters ')' and '(' .

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObject(System.Object)

member.param: Specifies the object to merge into the template.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObjects(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Interprets all public properties of the objects or the key names of the dictionaries in the collection as possible table columns and / or child tables. The type of the first object (or the key names and types of the first dictionary) in the collection is analyzed via .NET reflection and used as the basis of the assumed table structure. (In case of the collection containing objects of different types, the merge process is successful nevertheless, but some fields will be empty.) Properties of simple data types (e. g. string, int, enum) are converted to text using the ToString method. The textual representation of enum values can be specified using the System.ComponentModel.DescriptionAttribute. (For example: enum FoodCategory { [Description("Grains / Cereals")] Grains_Cereals, ... }.) The name by which Properties are mapped to field names can be adjusted using the System.ComponentModel.DisplayNameAttribute. (For example: [DisplayName("Name")] public string ProductName { get; set; }.) Complex properties which are themselves of type System.Collections.IEnumerable are interpreted as child Tables and used for merging merge blocks and nested merge blocks. This way data relations can be represented. Properties of a type itself having public properties are either interpreted as a simple table column (the merged text then is determined using the ToString() method) or they are treated as if they were a child table containing only one data row with the properties being the table columns. The second parameter specifies whether the single documents should be merged into one document or split into separate documents. The supported format of the merge fields can be found in the ASP.NET User's Guide.
member.param: Specifies a System.Collections.IEnumerable that contains the merge data.
Specifies whether the single documents should be merged into one document or split into separate documents.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObjects(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Does the same as MergeObjects with the parameter “append” set to true.
member.param: Specifies a System.Collections.IEnumerable that contains the merge data.

Specifies the name of the printer to which the output is sent.
Specifies the number of copies to print.
Collates output by printing every page of the first copy, then every page of the second copy, and so on.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.DataSources.MergeBlockInfo.Apply
member.summary: Stores the meta data (filters, sorting instructions and the block merging condition) in the SubTextPart which represents the block. Manipulating any of the aforementioned collections does not update the block automatically, so this method must be called to actually store changes. If a MergeBlockInfo instance is not based on an existing SubTextPart, this method throws an exception.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Drawing.MenuItem
member.summary: The Drawing.MenuItem class represents a bindable Windows Forms ToolStripMenuItem.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection
member.summary: The Drawing.Selection class represents all selected shapes.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.BringForward
member.summary: Increases the selected shapes' levels by one. The method has no effect if the CanBringForward property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.BringToFront
member.summary: Displays the selected shape as the uppermost shape of all shapes. The method has no effect if the CanBringToFront property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.SendBackward
member.summary: Decreases the selected shapes' levels by one. The method has no effect if the CanSendBackward property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.SendToBack
member.summary: Displays the selected shape as the lowest shape of all shapes. The method has no effect if the CanSendToBack property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(Drawing.Selection.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the Drawing.Selection.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete shapes selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the Drawing.Selection.Attribute enumeration.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanBringForward
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shapes' levels can be increased by one.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanBringToFront
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shape can be displayed as the uppermost shape of all shapes.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanSendBackward
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shapes' levels can be decreased by one.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanSendToBack

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.StatusBarViewGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StatusBarViewGenerator class. After initialization the Create method must be called to enable further resources.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.StatusBarViewGenerator.Create
member.summary: Initializes the resources of a newly instantiated object. This method must be called before using the object. To release created resources, Dispose should be called after using the object.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.TextViewGenerator.BeginUndoAction(System.String)
member.summary: Begins a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between BeginUndoAction and EndUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step. The specified user-defined name is available with the UndoActionName property.
member.param: Specifies the undo action's name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.TextViewGenerator.EndUndoAction
member.summary: Ends a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between BeginUndoAction and EndUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TextViewGenerator.Colors class. After creating the object with this constuctor, individual colors can be set. If the Colors object is assigned to the DisplayColors property, non-set colors are reset to their default values.

member.summary: Gets a clipping of an image as an array of bytes in Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format.
